website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for its high-quality construction for a reasonable price.
pros: Double-walled vinyl and welded seams ensure the bag  will keep out rain and snow
Two compression straps secure the bag to the car roof and prevent it from catching air
cons: Can only be used on vehicles with roof racks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This product was awesome for the trip I took to florida. It easy assemble on and off. It held more than I thought it would. We had roughly 5 different size bags in it along with miscellaneous items. It did rain on our trip and the luggage was still dry after. Only thing is to make sure your car has not just side rails but the cross rails as well. It came with all straps and tools needed.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a camping trip and after driving 18 hours, we found out it had ripped in three different areas during our drive. Rain had gotten in and filled the bottom portion soaking our tent and sleeping bags. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Jensen

customer_reviews.title: We made a 1800 mile round trip using the Shield ...
customer_reviews.text: We made a 1800 mile round trip using the Shield Jacket. I was very impressed. No tears or rips. The last 300 miles was in a downpour and when we unloaded everything was dry. So 1800 miles with no rips, tears or water. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Pageturner56

customer_reviews.title: This is likely the best $50 I've ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: We have a VW Jetta wagon. It was tight, but this fit on the top with the integrated rails and some aftermarket crossbars. Coming home from our recent camping trip we packed a six person tent, four camp chairs, three air mattresses, ground cloth and a large bag of family camping dirty laundry. Could have got more in. It stayed secure over 8 hours of interstate driving, and dry during a rain storm. Much better than the much more expensive big name brand carrier we borrowed from a neighbor last year.
customer_reviews.author: MarkN

customer_reviews.title: Worked out perfectly. Held up well. No problems ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out perfectly. Held up well. No problems with the straps, no breakage or tearing. Was everything I wanted it to be. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This rooftop cargo holder was excellent. We stopped a few times just to check it and it stayed in place. A bit hard to load at first (I'm short) but a good step ladder fixed that! We didn't experience rain so not sure about contents stayin dry. But it looks like they will. We packed 3 carry on sized bags plus 2 beach bags. Pillows blankets and a bag full of shoes. And jackets sweatshirts on top of bags. It was great! It came packed in a box which we repackaged it into when done. My husband put crossbars on our roof each. I don't think side bars alone will do.
customer_reviews.author: margaret m.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for my car storage problems.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these bags to hold clothes for my Direct Sales business. I have so much inventory that my car is completely loaded. I put some bags into the Shield Jacket on Saturday afternoon and we had a major thunderstorm on Saturday night. Not one drop of water got into the bag and everything was perfect. I used the bag for about a 100 mile round trip ride on the highway and it work fabulously. It was also easy to install onto the bars and to load and unload. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a rooftop carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla B. McSweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great price, and definitely weatherproof!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after comparing others from different stores. There were similar ones, at about the same price, but they were not weatherproof. We were driving to Iowa from Texas, so we needed the weatherproof aspect. It was easy enough to load on the car, and kept everything dry as we traveled on the highways with lots of rain. Folded up after we were done, and was good to go. The only thing that was not the easiest, was cinching some of the straps. the ones on top to tighten it down were quick and easy, but the ones on the end, I had to undo and rethread. But not a big deal. Would definitely recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dak J. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Fair Quality
customer_reviews.text: First time we packed it far a long trip two of the buckles would not stay snaped together so we had to tie knots. Strap buckles will not fit thru the metal cleats holes on a Subaru Outback roof system, so those had to be tied as well. Noticed upon repacking for the return trip that two of the straps appeared to be slightly tearing away from their attachment points. went thru several rains and everything inside stayed nice and dry. This is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a 14 hour each way trip. Held up great. The last one I used for a long trip was shredded and useless when I got to Virginia. Luckily I had bought it somewhere that had a good return policy. This looked as good as the day I put it on when I got back and it held up great even at speeds up to 90MPH.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Fiol

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! It fit 3 regular sized duffel bags
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It fit 3 regular sized duffel bags, two grocery sized bags, and some other miscellaneous items with ease, and room to spare. The clasps are heavy duty, and easy to use. We do not have side rails, only front and rear, but the side straps were long enough to wrap around the front and rear rails, adding extra support. We did use two additional ratchet straps and criss-crossed the bag, but it was not necessary. The straps themselves were enough to securely fasten the bag-sket to the roof. We drove almost 1,000 miles and our items stayed secure, and dry. Would definitely purchase this product again, and recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Girl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: First of all the one day shipping was late and the product box was very damaged. Ordered this for a road trip and it seemed quite nice however it was very difficult to attach to my 2017 Pathfinder. Just couldn’t get it to tighten at all. It also appeared to be too large for the factory installed roof rails and cross bars. From what I read the cargo box should fit inside the the crossbars and this bag exceeded that by about a foot or so. Wanted to say something really nice but wasn’t even able to test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Stalisha Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Bag went through 4 hours of heavy rainfall and all its contents were dry at our destination. The only improvement I'd recommend is to lengthen some of the straps on top. With a full bag, I struggled to get the straps around one of my crossbars and back up to fasten them. Other than that, bag appears durable and I plan to use it for next year's beach trip. The zipper is heavy duty and well protected. This does not appear to be a bag that is poorly built. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth any amount of money if it doesn't work, but solid company to deal with
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it did not hold up & it's outside of the return period. Using for the first time on a 500 mile trip. At some point during the first 400 miles, it ripped. Literally, at a store right now to look for duct tape!! **UPDATE: I was shortly contacted by the company to exchange or refund my money. I was very happy that they were willing to right the wrong & without me pressing the issue! I chose refund because I specifically bought it for the trip I was already on at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Janae W.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Fits Plenty of Baggage
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box I strapped this to the top of my car and set out on a 15 hour drive. I drove through rain, hail, snow, high wind, and it is currently baking out in the sun. I managed to fit a few duffle bags, blankets, and other miscellaneous items inside which saved a ton of space in my car. The inside of the bag was clean and dry when I arrived and the best part was that there was no annoying flapping or whistling sound while I was driving. I would highly recommend this to anyone for camping or travelling who doesn't want to spend a ton of money on a hard-shell.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Nurmberg

customer_reviews.title: Easy, inexpensive storage alternative to large hard plastic shells.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. Drove through a very heavy thunderstorm with no leaking issues. There was some minor wind noise from "vibrating" loose bag folds since we did not fill completely. Adjusted slightly cutting noise > 75%. Could be silenced more if I had taken greater time to adjust load but was little annoyance. Experienced no shifting of load. I used with a protective mat and would recommend trimming mat to a size smaller than the entire bag to keep it less exposed to the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Roger (Cincinnati)

customer_reviews.title: It will fall apart during your drive
customer_reviews.text: We noticed in the middle of a road trip that this was falling apart. The coating was shredding and falling apart. This will not last you very long. Might as well get one of those hard cases.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Kurdziel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.text: This carrier arrived promptly and was easy to use. It served its purpose well in securely mounting to my car's roof and carrying extra things on my move from Ohio to Florida. I did not experience any problems. I did make sure to follow instructions as to not overloading, and making sure items weren't sharp-edged. A little bit of condensation developed inside the carrier following a night of heavy frost, but not much.
customer_reviews.author: Auntjuju7

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for our trip from Ohio to North Carolina. We hit rain on nearly the entire trip back. Everything stayed perfectly dry. The straps are sufficient but do lack an easy way to adjust and tighten. While I don't think that would cause issues with the container falling off the car, it does increase the noise. If you have ever seen someone blow on a blade of grass to make it resonate, it is the same concept just a much lower frequency for hours on end. Overall I would still highly recommend this for people that don't regularly need the added cargo space.
customer_reviews.author: David J Watkins

customer_reviews.title: it is definitely water proof but in just a 2hr ...
customer_reviews.text: it is definitely water proof but in just a 2hr drive at 80mph the straps started ripping apart from the stitching part
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This product ripped within the first leg or our road trip (600 miles). It was attached correctly and securely and there was not inclimate weather or excess wind. It continued to rip more and more as we continued our trip. We had to purchase a tarp and additional straps just so we could finish our trip and return it when we arrived home. We were completely dissatisfied with this product and would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Grissom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I was kinda sceptical when my husband bought this and thought it was a waste of money but he proved me wrong. This soft topper held 3 suit cases, duffel bag, fishing waders, 3 sleeping bags and a few other things. We drove for about an hour and 20 mins and it held up very well. We didnt encounter any rain so I couldnt tell you if the waterproof was true. The zippers seem to be great quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: HOLLY

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for a drive from FL to CA ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a drive from FL to CA. I drove through several torrential downpours, scorching desert, and the hellish boondocks of the southern USA and this luggage bag did its job. It never budged, nothing inside got wet or otherwise damaged. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate S.

customer_reviews.title: Made it through all weather conditions
customer_reviews.text: Drove through 4+ hours of rain, sleet, snow, and sun(see pic) all our belongings were dry and bag was in great condition. Only reason i gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the main side straps are way too short. The bag wasnt even near full capacity and one side could not clip or even reach so one main side clip on each side of the suv I couldnt use. Also, its a small suv. I didnt not have crossbars and it still secured great.I attached the front and back straps to the side rails as well.
customer_reviews.author: L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Holds up and works
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 2 years now. It's a little unwieldy to get on, but it really works. We got stuck driving in a whiteout blizzard followed by rain; everything inside stayed dry. The straps seem a little flimsy but they work to position it; we use cargo-rated tie-downs to secure it. Do invest in zip ties to tie the straps up and prevent flapping. Totally worth the money paid for it though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazed and love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cargo bag for a trip from VA to FL. I was unsure about its water tightness due to all the reviews. It literally rained the entire 12 hour trip with a torrential down pour for 30 minutes in FL. Blinding, had to pull over rain, hazards on, etc. When we arrived, we envisioned laundry for the next few hours but to our astonishment, everything was DRY. D-R-Y!! I followed the instructions, packed items in bags (duffels and suitcases), and placed in cargo bag. Packed bag to about 50-60% capacity. Absolutely amazed and love this bag!!! Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: ... move across the country so I was expecting something sturdy to protect my belongings
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for my move across the country so I was expecting something sturdy to protect my belongings. It started ripping and falling apart almost immediately. It wasn't over stuffed or anything like that. I had to duct tape it before I even started my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle O

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant! We hit rain in the way to a camping trip and everything stayed dry. We only packed sleeping bags, pillows and foam pads in ours to make space for the heavier items in the trunk. I'm really impressed with the straps that lock it all into place. We filled it up first, then moved it to the top of the car. (We drive a minivan)
customer_reviews.author: PNW-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Held up perfectly for a road trip.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the negative reviews on this. Perhaps it's not the best for cold climates? I don't know... But I used it recently for a road trip to the desert for dune-buggy riding. It help everything we put in it just fine (motorcycle helmets and gear, etc.) and did just fine. We were in the hot sun, highway speeds, etc., and no problems at all. Very happy with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuy

customer_reviews.title: I will be using it under normal / hot conditions and it appears like it will hold ok
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Fits perfeclty in my Thule basket (2018 VW alltrack) The material is waterproof and folds over the zipper for added protection from the elements. I will be using it under normal / hot conditions and it appears like it will hold ok. It has several straps to secure it to the roof, but I would recommend sturdier ratchet straps to make sure nothing moves. You can secure access to the bag by adding your own small travel lock to the zipper handles.
customer_reviews.author: T.Ro

customer_reviews.title: Not rain-proof as promised
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product, I was excited. It seemed durable and road-trip ready. However, One quarter of the way through my trip, I ran into a rainstorm. I pulled off at a rest area after it passed to see if my cargo had stayed dry. I did not want my clothes getting moldy if the cargo carrier had failed to perform as promised. Sure enough, everything was soaking wet.
customer_reviews.author: Gummi Mummi

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in April for my trip to Florida in July. The reviews were pretty good. Unfortunately it's to late to return. We still have 6 hours to get home & the baggage carrier has shredded so bad we can use it. Very upsetting. Not sure how we're going to get everything back in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Performs as Described.  We Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from a camping trip to the Grand Tetons and we used the Shield Jacket to haul some of our bulkier items. The item was very easy to affix to our car and the flaps and Velcro were easy to figure out and adjust. During the trip we ran into the ubiquitous bugs, but also a number of rain showers and one strong thunderstorm. All our contents in the Shield Jacket remained dry and in perfect condition. This purchase was well worth it !!
customer_reviews.author: H.R.

customer_reviews.title: Highly durable! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a family vacation. Drove over 2,000 miles through desert and mounts in all kinds of weather and it certainly withstood the trip well. Definitely happy with my purchase! Back in the box like new for our next trip! Super value! Very sturdy material!!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, packed with soft gear and still torn a ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, packed with soft gear and still torn a hole within a 12 hour drive At least it didn't spill onto the freeway Won't be making the mistake of buying a soft cargo carrier again, plus not be able to lock it makes even going in for a food a worry it might be stolen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Subaru Outback + This Product = Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: For the price we paid it's been great. We have a 2011 Subaru Outback. Had to rig it a little differently (Put all 6 straps on the sides). And it held out great. Going to try only front and back on the next road trip to see if that's any better.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Despain

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: Drove 2 hours before it started to rip and is now exposing our luggage to any kind of weather. It is small can only hold 2 suitcases, we had 4. So pretty much useless and a waste of $50.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I transported two full-size luggage in the carrier and padded the bottom with a piece of cardboard. Made sure all the straps are tied down with nylon ties from the dollar store. Had no issues at all. Can't say if the carrier is waterproof, it was not raining that day. Product material is not very heavy duty but with some care (look out for sharp edges) it should last for a while. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwater Dragon

customer_reviews.title: A trustworthy product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Used this on our 6 hour trip through the winter storm around January 1st. We fit 2 medium suit cases and 2 child cases with some other odds and ends very easily. After zippering, closing the Velcro flaps and securing the straps everything stayed very dry. Return trip was as trustworthy as the first. When it is fully open be sure to face it where the top flap lays towards the front of your vehicle. Can't wait to take it on another trip soon!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised (Brownie Points)
customer_reviews.text: I should not be surprised, but I thought if this lasted at least one long trip it was worth it. I returned from a trip across heavily salted roads hauling a LOAD of Christmas presents. Not only did we get to our destination, but it was so secure, I don't think it shifted, slid, or scooted at all. I used a moving blanket on the inside and filled four large plastic tubs inside. The size was perfect, the dimensions could not have been better. I got real brownie points with the wife who didn't know how we were going to pull off the trip. Thanks - this made it possible, safe and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Done

customer_reviews.title: It seemed like it was durable
customer_reviews.text: I just recently used this on a trip to Va. It seemed like it was durable, I did not pack sharp objects or overload it. When I opened it up in Va, everything was wet....I took it off and realized that the drivers side of the Waterproof Roof Top cargo jacket had been shredded from the wind, as I didn't stop anywhere in between my home and destination. That just about ruined my vacation, beware this isn't as strong as it seemed
customer_reviews.author: ube

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on an Xterra
customer_reviews.text: This bag nestles right in between the crossbars of my 2012 Nissan Xterra when the bars are pushed all the way out. I do lose about 2-3 inches of total length by doing this, but I can always bring the crossbars closer so that the bag sits on the bars if I need every last inch of storage.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: Hold a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to got to FL , it fit so much stuff!. Only wish it had a lock on it so no one could open , when staying at hotels on way down. We did use a wrap around with a lock on it so could not be opened etc.Love it
customer_reviews.author: Merri Damico

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!!
customer_reviews.text: We used this on our 4,000 mile road trip from Colorado to Florida and back. We were very pleased with the protection this carrier provided through multiple rain storms, some of them quite heavy. Everything inside was completely dry. We did not even notice it was on the car and we are very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, durable, flexible, and stable.
customer_reviews.text: Took time to strap in. I had get on top to complete this but if take a small ladder u can do this from the ground. I combined two carriers. I also used an orange strap for my own mental wellness but it had plenty of sturdy straps. We used duffle bags instead of hard suitcases. Worked great for our trip!
customer_reviews.author: Nomadflyer

customer_reviews.title: works sooo well
customer_reviews.text: weather proofing is still holding up, no leaks around zippers, ties down really well, I actually now try to find things to do to use it. So happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and store
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because as a single person I wanted a carrier I could handle by myself. Also, when I arrived at my destination I folded it up and put it in my trunk and didn’t have to worry about it being stolen.
customer_reviews.author: hhhhhh

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed-update-replaced Highly appreciated!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March 2018 for our trip in November- NY to Florida the side corner had come apart-(wind tattered) not happy! Only could fit 2 hard case luggage bags and a soft duffel bag-that’s it on my Lincoln Navigator. Can not find info to contact sellers about it-just to give a review on product. ( Update...I contacted the seller-they emailed me back by next day-sending me a replacement...great customer service!)
customer_reviews.author: evee

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly on our family road trip. It fit our two large suitcases and we were able to shove softer items in the space spaces. It even rained and our luggage was dry. Great deal and well worth it. It fit well on our Subaru Forester.
customer_reviews.author: Labbadabba

customer_reviews.title: Not rain proof
customer_reviews.text: Quality was pretty decent for the most part. It leaked when we drove through light rain so I can't really recommend it for what it should be used for. If the contents will be waterproof then this will be a good fit for you. Installation is easy as long as you have rails.
customer_reviews.author: TNDealFinder

customer_reviews.title: Over the mountains and through the woods
customer_reviews.text: Used this bag to drive cross country. Held up through the desert and in a Texas storm. I did a ton of research before selecting this bag and it was worth it. Clips, zippers and straps all work. I added color zip ties to the zippers so I could easily find them.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have used this several times in our truck bed while traveling, one of those times it rained and everything stayed perfectly dry. It can fit a lot and hooks easily into the truck bed. When we aren't using it we can just fold it up and stick it in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: Great bag so far.
customer_reviews.text: Just received the bag and drove 1000 miles through snow and ice storms. It has held together so far and doesn't show any signs or tearing, ripping or other wear. All of our stuff is completely dry. I'll be back to report if any issues do occur, but it's a great value so far. Least expensive bag I could find and by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Xochimitl

customer_reviews.title: It held 1 large (29" suitcase) and 2 smaller (21") fairly easily.
customer_reviews.text: worked well for my long trip. was water-proof as advertised. the initial set up on the car took a bit of tinkering with the straps to get them all just right-and my Town and Country side rails are so low, that had to remove the buckles on the 4 side straps so they would slide through the small gap. It held 1 large (29" suitcase) and 2 smaller (21") fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Tested through rain going 80 mph
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for price. Drove 16 hours + for beach trip drove through multiple rain storms and one bag did get damp inside other than that everything else was completely dry. These storms were down pours. I'm satisfied with the product. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Zekesmom

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item becasue it leaked water during a road trip. Installed with zipper to the back as directed and still had wet clothes upon arrival. Currently looking for a hard top.
customer_reviews.author: Markt

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: We were happy because this solved a problem of space in our van for a trip we were taking. On the way home it rain the entire time and all the items in the bag got soaked. We were so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jenshea

customer_reviews.title: TRULY WATERPROOF!!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BAG, we packed it the night before our family vacation only to find there was a MONSOON storm that came that night, I was so afraid all of our stuff was going to be wet and to my surprise it wasn't! It is truly waterproof!!! It was easy to hook on and felt very secure. I have a 06 Jeep Liberty and it worked great for us! Wish I would have bought one years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA M.

customer_reviews.title: Not rigid, straps are cheap
customer_reviews.text: The straps aren't durable at all and adjust very poorly. Several slid right off at the buckle. Not safe. Seems pretty weatherproof but overall it's a big letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Ideal rooftop carrier that is both sturdy and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I just unpacked my new Shield Jacket rooftop carrier. I test fitted it to my Subaru Outback and filled it with two suitcases and a number of small soft sided duffels for a cross country trip. Everything fit well and was nice and snug when I cinched down all of the ties. It is sturdy, well constructed and the sewing is well done. I look forward to using this for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I liked what I saw and installation was easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 5000 mile road trip. I liked what I saw and installation was easy. However, after 1000 miles it ripped on one seam. Before it rained it didn't matter that much BUT after heavy rains, I found a bag of papers soaked and some leather product ruined. I taped it up with gorilla tape to get home but even that doesn't really stick to the rubber outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Philip M. Matzigkeit

customer_reviews.title: 1 trip under its belt and it did just what ...
customer_reviews.text: 1 trip under its belt and it did just what it was supposed to and held the weather out until one of the tension straps wore a hole in the side and on the strap itself. Can probably patch it and get a few more trips out of it
customer_reviews.author: Bob Malafronte

customer_reviews.title: Zipper flaps proved to be important since we had rain.
customer_reviews.text: We were concerned that it would not work for us because our siderails have no space underneath. However, we found that we could adequately secure the carrier using only the crossrails. We were able to stash a lot of stuff in it and keep it dry; also with no sound or any annoyance whatsoever. I recommend this product. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wettingfeld

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great buying transaction with seller. Unfortunately the light grey strap guides came off during our first trip.
customer_reviews.author: Ks

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: It worked like a charm in our 2017dodgejourbey to and from florida from Pennsylvania, through massive rainstorms eveything stayed dry and nothing ripped, great quality!
customer_reviews.author: sandra wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly as good as advertised. We traveled from Mississippi in torrential rain and then through a snow storm up north. When we arrived home our cargo was completely dry. It didn't fit our Durango top as well as it should have so we used an additional strap. The cargo was secure all the way home. Shipping was also very prompt. Would definitely purchase again from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Rainman40

customer_reviews.title: Bravo!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cargo carrier in everyway. We attached ours to an aftermarket roof rack system which was not designed specifically for the Shield Jacket, however the dimensions were accurately listed in the description and it fit perfectly. We then took a 3500 mile road trip encountering high winds, rain, snow, and it performed flawlessly. Easy to attach, easy to access, excellent craftsmanship and quality, water proof, durable, and a good value. I think it will work on my whitewater rafting expeditions as a dry bad. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: Durable waterproof bag!
customer_reviews.text: We traveled almost miles from Illinois to Alaska. I put the bag on the day before we left to make any adjustments. It rained every day. We had 2 bad storms we drove through as well. I never needed to tighten the bag on our trip and everything was dry at our destination! We drove through the mountains and the bag never shifted! This bag held up the entire way perfectly! We will be using this again on our next trip!!
customer_reviews.author: Mama6

customer_reviews.title: Leakes less than 1000 miles
customer_reviews.text: Update: leaks, got heavy rain this weekend,4.5.18, and tonight when it stopped, iopened the bag and my gear was soaked. I had weather boxes inside so no biggie, just the pack and gear that can get wet got wet, but still. Not even 1000 miles. Can't find any tears, so near as I can tell, it came from the zipper. Yes followed the directions for setup for those wondering. Original post: I have it strapped to the top of my element and have gone 600 miles so far and no problems. I will update if it tears or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good condition. Performed well during our 5 hrs trip. Bug stains were easy to wipe. It did not rain during the trip so I have no comment in that part.
customer_reviews.author: online_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it was good.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a bit bigger and longer and MOST DEFINITELY WATER REPELLENT. Some of our items got wet during a heavy rain on a trip. Other than that it was good.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This was more than I had expected. It is bigger and holds alot more than I thought it would. It was easy to attach to the roof top. The zippers and fabric is nice and thick and you can see the quality in the design.
customer_reviews.author: ch196u

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad it was inexpensive or I would call the product ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the "waterproof" is inaccurate. We installed as detailed in the directions to, but drove through heavy rainfall for a few hours and at the end had wet clothing in our bags. I'm glad it was inexpensive or I would call the product description false advertising. It's definitely not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Koetje-simin

customer_reviews.title: Long hall
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this cargo bag. It did end up getting a little rip near one of the straps but I love it enough that I will repair it. I should also say the rip was after around 5000 miles and 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Lover of all things

customer_reviews.title: Cargo carrier
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked it more if the straps front to back and side to side. I liked the way it unzipped in a horseshoe shape making it easy to load and unload. We packed it the night before we left for toad trip and it rained. Everything inside stayed dry. After recent road trip of about 1200 miles each way. Does show some road wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Dona Orsini

customer_reviews.title: I bought this item to transport some camping gear. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to transport some camping gear. Traveled MAYBE 500 miles before the thing was ripped and falling apart. Front corner was torn down and exposing my belongings. The buckle on one of the front straps broke shortly after. This thing barely made it 1000 miles before falling apart. Next time, I'm going to spend the extra money and get a hard shell cover.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Conry

customer_reviews.title: The carrier did not budge (I used a few extra cords just in case) and I was really happy I purchased this
customer_reviews.text: I put this on top of my car was 20 + hours of traveling. It ended up raining quite a bit and I really stuffed this carrier full. When I reached my destination everything was completely dry and secure. The carrier did not budge (I used a few extra cords just in case) and I was really happy I purchased this. It is both easy to install & easy to store when you are done with it.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Spacious!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for on top of our Chrysler Town and Country mini van. We have 3 little ones so it was wonderful to be able to add so much packing space for our 12 hour trip to myrtle beach! This carrier is durable and we made the 700+ mile trip down and back with no problems at all. It secures easily and firmly. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn D.

customer_reviews.title: Good company Good product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality and price. We are more than satisfied. We love that the straps are two per side, making it very secure, and that the zipper is covered to prevent leakage in storms.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Good when tight on space.
customer_reviews.text: These did very well over a 1700 mile drive, but are not waterproof. Arrived with some wet clothing, but overall I’m very happy that the bags held up well through multiple weather conditions and a long journey.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Beaton

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a 600 mile trip and it worked great. Very durable. We drove through wind and rain with no issues. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Becks

customer_reviews.title: Nothing got wet inside and we went thru some very hard rain.
customer_reviews.text: I really did like the cargo carrier and will be buying another one in the near future. One for the top and one for the cargo carrier attached to the hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Larryb

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I recently went on a road trip from Texas to Arizona, and through New Mexico and Utah. It rained very little so the waterproofing wasn't well tested, but it held up in some sprinkles and I would have to assume it'll do well in regular rain (don't know about a storm though). But it withstood temperatures into the hundreds very nicely. And LOTS of space, I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa N Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Received it fast and have taken it on three trips, love it so far, on one trip it really poured for over an hour and everything stayed dry. Very pleased, Thank you
customer_reviews.author: 30calgal

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful protection. Lasted a 13 hour drive one way. No leaks, no flapping, no loosening. Only thing I'd recommend is get a bag for it to store it when not in use, it packs real small.
customer_reviews.author: Customer99999

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on a 5 hour trip
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on a 5 hour trip. This thing held a lot more than I thought it would! Only issue I had was the snap on one of the buckles kept coming undone as I tightened it down.
customer_reviews.author: AstroCat's Fan

customer_reviews.title: Works as Designed, Tie up Loose Ends so they Don't Fray
customer_reviews.text: Just back from our first 700+ mile trip w/ the Shield Jacket. It functions as described. Takes a little practice to know how to pack it and if you're not careful about making sure that any excess straps are tied up, they will fray. Other than that, it's a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: B. Trigg

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: Well, it was easy to get attached to the top of the van. Fit my Chrysler Pacifica. Holds a decent amount BUT.... and I do mean BUT. It is NOT waterproof. We ran into a bunch of rain while using it and everything was SOAKED. So in the future we will cover it with a tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Catgreeneyes

customer_reviews.title: This was easy for me to secure on top of my SUV ...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy for me to secure on top of my SUV by myself. Great for garbage bag soft clothes, sleeping bags, pillows. Would not put too heavy or sharp items, but flat items secure well on the bottom and frees room inside of those type of items.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Corley

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: We drove over 1000 miles with this bag on top of our car. It can hold a lot of stuff and it is waterproof. We drove through some heavy rain on the way and nothing got wet. But if you packed the bag really full, as we did, you would probably want to get some extra straps to wrap around it. It is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for extra storage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, kept everything dry through the rain we went through. Much easier to store than a hard top for a fraction of the cost.. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Italyjay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cargo carrier
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cargo carrier. We had trouble with the first one and we contacted the company and they replaced it with a new one. Protects your luggage even when it rains. Worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Redbird48

customer_reviews.title: We ordered this travel unit for our spring break trip ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this travel unit for our spring break trip. It work just as described. It was roomy enough for one large and small roller suitcase along with two additional bags and a backpack (and various other smaller items.) It held up to the elements (high winds and rain). Everything was completely dry and intact once we got home from a 34 hour round trip drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The shield Jacket it very durable! We drove from Mustang, Ok to Mount Rushmore then on to Yellowstone. We headed home going through Colorado. We had absolutely NO issues with this item. We stuffed it full and left it in tact the whole trip. It even sustained a huge bird in Yellowstone eating dead bugs from the front of it. We hit several light showers and the dead bugs were easily washed off. Items inside stayed totally dry. Best purchase I've made in awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to use and secure with straps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for a short vacation. Great quality, easy to use and secure with straps. This thing holds alot of stuff. Three duffle bags, a large backpack, jackets, a large pillow, and still had room for a few more items. Holding up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pj

customer_reviews.title: I was very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a 3,300 mile trip. I had tarp over it so I can't say how it holds up to the elements on its own, however, I was very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Broken Clip
customer_reviews.text: One of the clips broke on the first outing, I would love if somebody would send me a replacement but not sure who to contact about that.
customer_reviews.author: Mentor Pam

customer_reviews.title: Thank nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: You just need to check the straps often to make sure they don't come loose. Thank nice product for the price. All traveled 1000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie M Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lexus Rx350. Drives great - but zero storage for more then overnight bags. We took a road trip (13 hours) to go camping. We had to bring our own blankets and linens. This carrier was a life saver! It poured rain and everything stayed bone dry.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: The weather was not bad, the weather was normal and a non-windy day
customer_reviews.text: The VERY FIRST time we used this product, on a short trip, it started coming apart at the seams. The weather was not bad, the weather was normal and a non-windy day, and the product started breaking at the seams excessively. We have only used it one time because we are afraid it will come apart on the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

product_meta.title: SHIELD JACKET Waterproof Roof Top Cargo Luggage Travel Bag (15 Cubic Feet) - Roof Top Cargo Carrier for Cars, Vans and SUVs - Great for Travel or Off-Roading - Double Vinyl Construction, Easy to Use
feature_bullets: Spacious Roof Bag: Whether you’re planning a cross-country trip or you’re in the mood for a little off-roading, our roof top carrier is ready for any adventure! Great for cars, vans or SUVs with roof rack systems, it provides 15 cubic feet of convenient, secure storage.

Completely Weatherproof: Our cargo carrier is ready to brave the elements! With welded seams to seal out water, it’s totally weatherproof and protects your gear against rain, grit, snow, wind and sun. Ideal for family road trips, it increases the space inside your vehicle.

Easy to Use: Thanks to 8 built-in tie straps, our car top carrier attaches in only a matter of minutes! At 43”x34”x17,” it comfortably holds odd-shaped and oversized objects. When it isn’t in use, the soft-sided, compact design allows you to fold and store it anywhere.

Trusted Quality: Thanks to double-wall vinyl construction and 2 compression straps, our car top luggage carrier is strong, durable and designed to last! You can rest assured and enjoy the trip knowing all of your belongings are securely in place and well protected.

Shop Risk Free: The SHIELD JACKET team wants to help you make the most of all of life’s adventures! If for any reason you’re not completely satisfied with your cargo bag, you can return it for a full refund using our risk-free, three-month money back guarantee.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars451 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
